thread.title: Freddy the Octopus brings Christmas cheer to children in new book

author: Lewis Clarke
title: Freddy the Octopus brings Christmas cheer to children in new book
text:
News Freddy the Octopus brings Christmas cheer to children in new book The idea for the book which has just gone on sale emerged from a collection of children’s rhymes Share Jo Mortimer, Kayleigh and Andrew with their new book Freddy the Octopus (Image: Jo Mortimer) Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A poet and an artist from Tiverton have worked together to produce a unique children’s book, ‘Freddy the Octopus’.
The idea for the book which has just gone on sale emerged from a collection of children’s rhymes written by Andrew Herniman, former headmaster of Tiverton’s St.Aubyn’s Prep School. He then worked on the project in collaboration with well-known artist Jo Mortimer who produced a series of artworks to illustrate the book.
Andrew said the inspiration for the poems came from a lifetime of working with children as well as keeping five grandchildren entertained.
“I aim to make my poems fun with lots of rhythm and rhyme, he said. “Hopefully in this way they have a musical appeal when read out loud.
“Most of the ideas seem quite silly, but children appear to enjoy the fun and nonsense.” Read More Campaigners head to Tiverton calling for a People's Vote on Brexit
Jo’s whose iconic paintings of Tiverton have proved immensely popular has designed the town’s official Christmas card for the last six years and has also organised several people participation artworks, some of which are now on display around Tiverton.
“I loved the idea of illustrating Andrew’s poems and found them quite inspirational. The whole project was a lot of fun, and I enjoyed teasing out ideas from the words.”
The book is now available at Tiverton’s independent bookstore, Liznojan, in Gold Street. Read More
